explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 18degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 1999) and the boiling point is 136degC, which is classified into Category 2. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1175) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 432degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1175)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 3,500mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 3,500mg/kg (EHC 186 (1996)) and 4,769mg/kg (ATSDR (1999))

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 15,400 mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (1999 hour inhalation of vapour) value of 17.2 mg/L (4,000 ppm) (ATSDR (1999), EHC 186, (1996)) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (9,000 ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.9 kPa (20degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of primary skin irritation tests (ATSDR (1999)): "A 24-hour application causes mild skin irritation" (ethyl benzene is considered mildly irritating to the skin, though the results are not those of 4-hour application).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 186 (1996)) "mild irritation to the conjunctiva, and no or reversible effects, if any, on the cornea." The substance is thus considered slightly or mildly irritating to the eye.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Insufficient data available, the substance is considered to cause no skin sensitization, based on the results of skin sensitization tests on human volunteers (ACGIH (7th, 2002), EHC 186 (1986)). However, these results are insufficient to make conclusions about the skin sensitization, which is not evaluated by ACGIH.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in SIDS (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 2B by IARC (2000) and Category A3 by ACGIH (2001).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description of mice/rat teratogenicity tests (CERI Hazard Data 96-41 (1998), SIDS (2005), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1 (2002)): Toxic effects on the embryo (urinary malformation) are observed at dosing levels not toxic to maternal animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (central nervous system), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the results of animal experiments (CERI Hazard Data 96-41 (1998)): The effects on experimental animals are observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2, with respiratory irritation also observed.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.4mg/L of the crustacea (Brown Shrimp) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (it was easy to degrade in essentials and to strip from water (SIDS (2005))) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=3.15 (PHYSPROP Database (2005))), it was claasified into Not classified.
